content.question: Which of the following best describes the scientists’ findings concerning the density of symbionts presented in Figure 2 ?

choices.label: The symbiont density at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on day <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was less than the density on day <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the experiment.

The symbiont density at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on day <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was less than the density on day <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the experiment.

The symbiont density at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was different from the density at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on days <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the experiment.

The symbiont density at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was higher than the density at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for the entire length of the experiment.

content.answer: The symbiont density at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was different from the density at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on days <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the experiment.

skill.text: 5.B: Use confidence intervals and error bars to estimate whether sample means are statistically different.
